content: **note ** this is a pattern recipe with information to make a basket or plate shaped coiled vessel yardage information included will make either one plate or two baskets but can vary depending on your gauge these vessels came to be with a little change in hands the original chunky lengths of crochet chains were made by oma not mine but someone i know and i set about using the crochet chains as cords for coiled vessel making crocheted together you can find ~150 g balls of crochet chains at little blue fibre studio in edmonton alberta canada made by oma but the recipe includes directions for making the crochet chain - you can start from scratch as well it s a great way to use up odd bits of yarn and add a little splash of colour to your yarn related decor i ve been using the baskets as a yarn bowl or as a place to store small bits of wool the plates are excellent for displaying larger items **skills required** familiarity with crochet stitches and open to some trial and error the trickiest part is getting started once you have a few coiled rounds worked you can continue coiling to make a plate shape or start stacking the coils to make a basket shape **finished measurements** basket two 7 / 18 cm diameter x approx 3 5 / 9 cm tall **or** plate one 10 / 25 5 cm diameter x approx 1 / 2 5 cm tall **materials** mc 1 skein briggs & little heritage 2-ply 100% wool 215 yds / 197 m 113 g / 4 oz colourway natural white or approx 150 yds / 137 m worsted weight yarn crochet cord 1 skein each briggs & little heritage 2-ply 100% wool 215 yds / 197 m 113 g / 4 oz colourway fern triple-stranded yellow double-stranded orange double-stranded and pink single-stranded or approx 430 yds / 394 m worsted weight yarn suggested hook size mc f5 / 3 75 mm crochet cord m/n13 / 9 mm **abbreviations** us terms **bor** - beginning of round **chain** - chain **mc** - main colour **single_crochet** - single_crochet i hope you ll enjoy this woolly version of vessel making
